GetDynamicTextSize(Double, Vector2, Vector2)

Gets the size for dynamic text.

Declaration
public static Vector2 GetDynamicTextSize(in double timeOffset, in Vector2 dynamicScale, in Vector2 endingScale)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Double timeOffset

The time offset. This is often the difference between when the character was printed and the current time.
Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2 dynamicScale

The scale of the dynamic modifier.
Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2 endingScale

The ending scale of the text.
Returns
Type Description
Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2

A Vector2 containing hte size for dynamic text.

GetWavyTextOffset(Double, Double, Vector2)

Gets the positional offset for wavy text.

Declaration
public static Vector2 GetWavyTextOffset(double timeVal, double timeOffset, in Vector2 amount)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Double timeVal

The time value to use. Can be ActiveMilliseconds or another timer.
System.Double timeOffset

The time offset. This is usually the time between rendering each character in a dialogue bubble.
Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2 amount

The max amount to offset.
Returns
Type Description
Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2

A Vector2 containing the offset for wavy text.

ParseText(String, out String)

Parses text for a Dialogue Bubble, reading in control codes and converting them to text modifiers, message modifiers, and message routines.

Declaration
public static DialogueGlobals.BubbleData ParseText(in string bubbleText, out string nonHtmlOutput)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String bubbleText

The string containing the text for the Dialogue Bubble.
System.String nonHtmlOutput

A string that will be the bubbleText returned without control codes.
Returns
Type Description
DialogueGlobals.BubbleData

A new BubbleData with all the necessary data for a Dialogue Bubble to function.
| Improve this Doc View Source
